meanings.definition: Not capable of being made into a film.
meanings.sent1: The complex novel was unfilmable due to its intricate plot.
meanings.sent2: The book's detailed descriptions made it unfilmable for a movie adaptation.
meanings.sent3: Trying to turn that story into a film would be like trying to fit a square peg into a round hole - completely unfilmable!
meanings.sent4: The essence of her dreams was unfilmable, impossible to capture on screen.
meanings.sent5: The unfilmable nature of the play left the director feeling frustrated and defeated.

meanings.definition: Impossible to adapt into a movie.
meanings.sent1: The surreal nature of the story made it unfilmable for mainstream audiences.
meanings.sent2: The unfilmable script presented a challenge to even the most experienced filmmakers.
meanings.sent3: Trying to make that into a movie would be like trying to teach a fish to climb a tree - completely unfilmable!
meanings.sent4: The emotions portrayed in the book were unfilmable, too raw and intense for the screen.
meanings.sent5: The unfilmable scenes in the screenplay haunted the producer, knowing they could never be brought to life.
